python.code: """ Adler-32 is a checksum algorithm which was invented by Mark Adler in 1995. Compared to a cyclic redundancy check of the same length, it trades reliability for speed (preferring the latter). Adler-32 is more reliable than Fletcher-16, and slightly less reliable than Fletcher-32.[2] source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adler-32 """ def adler32(plain_text: str) -> int: """ Function implements adler-32 hash. Iterates and evaluates a new value for each character >>> adler32('Algorithms') 363791387 >>> adler32('go adler em all') 708642122 """ MOD_ADLER = 65521 a = 1 b = 0 for plain_chr in plain_text: a = (a + ord(plain_chr)) % MOD_ADLER b = (b + a) % MOD_ADLER return (b << 16) | a
